dialogue: Like installations? Sorry to eavesdrop. I’m a big art fan.
That is so right on. We don’t. Nobody tells you that you won’t ever get to jump on a trampoline again.

Not to mention that the whole concept of motherhood that we are sold is such bullshit - you’re going to be expected to figure this whole thing out alone without any village to speak of, you’re going to get no maternal benefits from the government, you’re going to be mocked in popular culture, and there’s basically a billion dollar industry that’s designing products made to make you feel like you’re a terrible mother! But seriously, congratulations.
WHOAAAA. You are blowing my freakin’ mind.
We’re so powerful. Men must be terrified of us. Look at you! You’re a fucking miraculous goddess who is growing bones.
This is why people have sister wives.
I don’t have any friends that are moms. As she says this she realizes it’s true.
The parakeet. I hated that bird.
I don’t know yet; it’s really new - he’s staying at the Extended Stay America.
I feel like I should try to talk to * the reporter. *
